review_body: The hotel is relatively new. I like that it comes with a Japanese style buffet breakfast but the last entry is at 9.30 am, a little earlier than the usual 10 am. If you are already in there before 9.30 am, you can continue to eat. The room is on the smaller side but enough for one person. And I like the bathroom, which is a good size. There is a small bathtub, good separate shower and of course the Japanese style toilet with music and all. All the basic amenities are provided; kettle, tea/coffee, there is also a trouser presser? But I prefer a proper iron so I requested one from the reception. The location is also convenient, not too far from the subway and is also on the quieter side. There is no gym at the hotel, but you want to be out and about when you are in Tokyo. The check- out is also easy with a kiosk, which you just have to insert your key card. I would return and stay there again for sure.

Stayed 7 nights, a double and a twin bed on 12th floor. We would recommend twin bed for grown up kids as the double is approx 150-160 cm wide. The room is modern and very convenient. The bathroom has a tub and a separate shower cabin. The shower is powerful and efficient. The A/C is very responsive and efficient. There are multiple USB power outlets spread all over the room so there will be no problem to charge your devices. The beds are quite firm as is the pillows.I read a review about mold and moisture in the bathroom, we experienced nothing of that. Water bottles can be purchased in the 7-eleven store in the building. The room is quite small by international standards but very normal for Tokyo. The breakfast is also very nice with a mixture of western food like scrambled eggs, sasuage, bacon, bread, yoghurt and asian food like dumplings and Japaneese specialities. A chocolate fountain was also available for sweet lovers... The location is perfect. Quite business area close to subway station yet an area with a number of restaurants within walking distance.We would definitely recommend this hotel and whenever we come back we will stay here.

Horrible stay due to moldy smell coming from bathroom. The bathroom is very poorly ventilated and as a result stays humid and smells of mold. The rooms are small which is not a problem. However, there is no customer service or complimentary water bottle.

Spent a week in this hotel for our 2nd visit to Tokyo. Absolutely loved it! The hotel is newish, has great rooms, excellent bathroom, good facilities. There is a nice little 7/11 in the basement of the hotel - which we visited often! Hotel is a reasonable walk to Shinjuku station (maybe 20 mins) - otherwise it's a 5-10 min walk to the nearest subway. There are quite a number of local eateries within walking distance. Enjoyed trying out a number of them. Staying here made our stay that much more enjoyable. Would happily recommend this hotel to anyone - whether business or pleasure.

I really enjoyed y 6 night at Daiwa Roynet Nishi Shinjuku. Rooms are pretty new, comfortable, clean and pretty spacious (for Tokyo standard).The position is excellent, walking distance from Tochomae and Nishi-Shinjuku metro stations.Much appreciated having a 7 Eleven under the hotel.I will definitely stay here again, next time in Tokyo.

We enjoyed our 4 night stay. Our teens had a small room with a spacious bathroom and separate toilet. We had a large room with a separate bedroom, also with a spacious bathroom and separate toilet (Junior Suite). The beds are firm, but by the second night we were used to them. We would highly recommend the larger room as it provided a great space for us all to get together comfortably.The rooms are very clean and the hotel staff are helpful and friendly.The location is great - a 5 min walk to the closest small train station, or an easy 15 minute walk to enormous Shinjuku Station. The Shinjuku Nishi area is relaxing as not frantic like a lot of Tokyo.There are restaurants very close, plus Starbucks and the Hilton nearby has a great bakery. We loved the small sushi bar style restaurant across the main road. We went to Roys Cafe in the hotel for a simple breakfast each morning including good coffee. A more extensive breakfast is available at the restaurant,

We have enjoyed our 3 night stay at Daiwa Roynet. The rooms aren’t big but it does have a large bathroom . The room is extremely clean and near new. It was fine for a family of 4. And very affordable for Tokyo. We paid around $400 a night which included breakfast. The hotel is close to the train and a number of great restaurants. Getting here from the airport (Narita) was easy on the Friendly Limousine bus . It dropped us at the Hilton & we walked 2mins around the corner. We would most definitely stay here again!

This is our 1st stay at Daiwa Roynett chain of hotels. I booked a standard twin room for 3 nights. Pros:1) Location is about 10-15 minutes walk to Nishi-shinjuku Metro Station - easy access to other transportation lines in Tokyo. Main Shinjuku Station can also be reached within 20-30 mins walk.2) Room is slightly bigger compared to typical Japanese standards - reason of choosing this hotel.3) Room equipped with amenities - including pajamas and fabric deodorizer! 4) Cozy breakfast area: Breakfast buffet was good : has both western and Japanese - not splurge in terms of varieties but yet filing and tasty.5) Staff were attentive and courteous very polite.6) Convenience stores - 7 Eleven (just downstairs of the hotel) & 2 Family Mart within 7-10 minutes walking (otw to Nishi-shinjuku Station)7) Provided with facial mask during check-in8) DIY laundry & microwave provided 9) Tokyo Metropolitan Building is nearby10) Nearby Shinjuku Park11) I like the fact that during night time, the place is not busy at all with traffic & people compared to morning. Even though located and surrounded within office towers, skyscrapers and government buildings, its quiet deserted during night time.Cons:1) No swimming pool or onsen2) Size of the room is just nice for 2 people - cannot open your luggage as there is no space.Even though does not have certain facilities which is not even an issue for me, consider staying in Japan, I felt very pleasant staying here and kind miss it.

Location: Within the Shinjuku area but outside the city center, the hotel is a 6 minute walk from the nearest Shinjuku metro exit. It has a 7-11 in the basement so getting what you need is easy and cheap. There are many restaurants around the area going to the metro. Room and Amenities: Small rooms are a norm in Tokyo. But the hotel and the room/toilet are beautifully decorated. Modern and sleek. The toilet bowl is standard modern Japanese. Automated sensor with built-in bidet and water pressure control, heated seats, and even atmosphere noise for privacy. I also specially like the light controls and electric/USB outlets by the bedside. The room has the usual amenities though there’s no safe. It’s got a mini fridge, hairdryer, closet, a writing table and chair, a tiny couch. Not bad. Toilet has the usual toiletries like toothbrush/toothpaste, comb, razor and a sponge towel. Body soap,shampoo and conditioner are in large bottle dispensers. Staff: The staff are courteous and pleasant. They can converse quite well in English. I would stay here again. I’d also recommend this hotel to my friends.

Stayed five nights in this hotel and enjoyed every one. The hotel is great because... - It’s very good value for money. I’ve stayed in 5* hotels that aren’t as good. It’s also very modern, super clean and quiet. - It’s very close to Shinjuku, 15 mins by foot or 5 mins to a tube station and one stop so you can head out exploring. Yes the rooms are small, but they are fine. You could swing a cat without a problem. A few little extras: - Shampoo and conditioner is decent so you don’t have to worry about bringing your own - There is a washing machine on site incase you need to wash your things

Hotel locates walkable distance from subway Station, with supermarket and convenient stores in walkable distance. Room is small as other hotels in Japan, but it is clean. Staff is professional and bed is comfortable.

Clean rooms and quite high-quality amenities provided, though the accommodation for 3 people was a bit tight. The front desk supported multiple languages including English, so they are well-catered for an international clientele. You can borrow an umbrella from the front desk for those rainy days (provided they have spares). Breakfast is not complementary, and comes extra. It's not too far to walk to Shinjuku itself, and there is a well-stocked and extensive convenience store in the hotel, as well as a nearby Denny's and Starbucks. Checkout can be done by a kiosk without needing to go to the front desk.

Booked 2 nights here staying in a triple-bedded room, but it was more like a twin room with an extra bed added in. That said, check-in was a breeze, so was check-out! They have an automated service, and you'd really only need to go to the counter to get your passport scanned (personal verification). I really like their pajamas (top and trouser set), and the toiletries were great. Some places don't provide conditioner, but they do. It's closer to Nishi-shinjuku station on the metro line than to Shinjuku station, but it's not a long walk - about 15 minutes away. There's also a convenience store located at the basement of this hotel, which is great for midnight snacking.I really like that the hotel is modern, and that the front desk staff speak a variety of languages (English, Chinese, Vietnamese and, of course, Japanese). It makes it really easy for communications, and I really appreciate that.Staying at this hotel is easy, and I'd definitely stay there again. Just maybe not book a triple room next time.

The service of this hotel has dropped my rating for the hotel itself to below average. The reception staff were not helpful at all. We arrived after a 10 hour flight and requested early check in. We were asked to pay for early check in which we were happy to do and we got access at 12pm. We came back at 11:45am and whilst our room was ready we were told to wait until 12pm. We stayed at 4 other hotels during our visit to Japan and never were we asked to pay for check in at noon when a room is available. Other requests for assistance were barely acknowledged - dry cleaning of one pair of trousers took 4 days and when we asked them to bring it upstairs for us they looked at us like it was an absurd request; we were getting a package delivered with our JR passes and they would not assist us with receiving the package. The rooms were on the smaller size which we could deal with as it was clean but do not expect any service from here. I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends and family.

Loved the bathroom with the separate shower & bathtub; also separate hi-tech toilet (which we’ve come to realize is the norm for all hotels in Japan !) good toiletries too. The laundry on our floor(10th) was an added bonus. The 7/11 store in the basement was very useful - we could get water, fruits etc there.The room though small, had enough space for everything. Bed & pillows very comfy-slept really well.The lobby wasn’t glamorous, but the room & every other convenience was more important. Check in & check out was very quick.The coffee was excellent !Did not have breakfast there... so can’t comment on the food.Was close to Nishi Shinjuku station... which is one stop away from Shinjuku station -so..well connected too.It would have been nice to get complimentary drinking water without foregoing the room cleaning !!!!Anyway.. as the 7/11 was just below, it was not a problem.

Stayed 3 nights. small but comfortable and clean room. 15 minutes walk to Shinjuku station. had no issues at all. staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. there is a 7/11 in the basement. breakfast was also good. My stay was really perfect

A short walk from the Nishi Shinjuku metro station. If staying for a few days would recommend the Pasco card or similar - very convenient, easy to purchase from any station and easy to top up. We had a standard double room booked at this hotel and were shocked by how tiny the room was if you have 2 suitcase there really isn’t any room for them. We upgraded one notch and got a bigger room with a bigger bed. The extra room was mostly taken up by a rather pointless massage chair but nevertheless for a 3 night stay the larger room was definitely more practical. We found the hotel clean and comfortable.

What works - the place is located in the heart of the Shinjiku business district.. the room , toilets , linen are clean and well maintained.. the service is excellent.. everything in the room and toilet was functional.. the toilet commode had automatic functions for wash.. What does not work.. the rooms are very small .. just enough for two but if there is a lot of luggage then there is a crowd in the rooms..

Hotel located close to Metro station. Elegant yet simple design in lobby. Service at front desk was excellent. Quick and easy check-in. I was directed to pay for hotel stay by using their computer located on side wall. Hotel can hold your luggage if necessary. Messaging system in room was great (I had my rail pass delivered to the hotel). Room was good design for size of room. Room was quiet. Room small (as I expected) and very clean. However, the bathroom was large with separate tub and shower. Housekeeping was excellent! Nice view of city from room. Room had a safe. Bed was comfortable. Central A/C & heat. Convenience store 7/11 located at bottom of hotel. Great for late night snacks, etc. Prices were average.

Location is a 10 minute walk to the metro or 20 minutes to the JR station if you have a pass. Staff are very helpful, standard room is small and as we had 2 large, 2 small and 2 backpacks there’s not much room left.Bathroom is small but well laid out and adequate.

Pictuer this one.... You left Sydney with a child who went sick on you in the terminal, a flight to Hong King with a 7hr stopover, redeye flight to Haenada arriving at 5am and you have to wait until 1pm to check in. Leavves you pretty buggered and with an unwell child, more so than usual. Your hotel checks you in a bit earlier, which is really nice, then your 3 person room (2 adults, 1 Child as booked on booking.com) turns out not to be the one in the picture with a double and a single bed, but a tiny room with a double bed. "Yes, that is the room you booked." said the desk staff. Both the wife and I chekced and rechecked when we booked some months earlier and this was not the room or arrangement. What we were about to learn was a lesson in misleading customers by ommision, from both a hotel chain and booking.com. Which really dissapointed us no end as I liked the look of this hotel, and it was new. What I can't review here is the facilities, rooms, resurraunt or location as we didn't stay there. What I can review is the staff - polite, even whilst caught between their employer, the manager who wouldn't support them and booking.com who lost them business and left them to deal with angry customers.They did get a booking.com rep on the phone who basically didn't care and had no interest or empathy, for either the hotel or ourselves. They approached the hotel manager repeatedly at our request, who would not come out of the office to see us, leaving it to the desk staff. I feel for the staff, but we chose not to spend money with two orgainsations that would treat us so poorly after miselading us.Here is what unfloded. We used booking.com to find suitable accomodation at a good price, choosing this hotel. We completed the search fields with 2 adults and 1 child (under 8). The room we chose showed a double and a single bed and the details indicated it was suitable for 3 persons. We toook the breakfast option, chose "pay at the hotel" and confirmed. After booking, the hotel took full payment immediately form the card and then informed us that there was an additional breakfast charge for our child. This taking of payment was a bit rude, the demand for the extra breakfast fee was very rude, but the room was the rudest insult of the lot, only to be follwed by the abonination at the front desk. Now, whilst our issue was going on, there was another family going through the same issue over their 17 year old. We also saw it again at another hotel! 3 times in one day and all booking.comSo what was the cause? Several major failures in booking.com's process that I now think are there to trap customers. You see, we found out that in Japan, they considder that your child will share the bed with you, so they do not charge you for the child, just for the additional breakfast. Booking.com and other booking websites don't tell you this, nor do they tell you that younger teens are considdred and adult and that if you want your child in a sperate bed, you must book them as an adult and pay for them as an adult. We found only one Japanese hotel that stated this upfront and it was the Hilton chain, only on thier own website. So, what did we do, we pulled our book, got a refund in full with no cancellation fees, retired to a coffe shop up the road and found another hotel. We did spend the extra money to get a bed for our child and decided that we were not going to use Diawa Roynet hotels for Koyto or our return to Tokyo. We have now cancelled all emails and membership of booking.com, will no longer use them ofr personal or business travel and will be reporting them to NSW Fair Trading so that they are forced to enact a full fees disclosure. ie: That when they show you a price based on your search criteria as an Australian user, that price is the final price, as is done in the EU. Please feel to join in if you have had this issues full price dislosure on any booking website.

Hotel is pretty new. In fact they were still doing some work at the hotel front but had no effects on our stay. Hotel itself was quite small as most Japanese hotels are.Rooms are comfortable and practicle. No complaints at all. Love the bathroom ! Location wise it is brilliant for Shinjuku station. Only 10 minutes walk away.There is a 24hr 7 eleven in hotel basement which is incredible.

This hotel is quite new with very clean rooms in the quiet area of Nishi Shinjuku and only a short walk to subway stations that are only 1 to 2 stops to the busier parts (restaurants, nightlife etc) of Tokyo. Service from staff was excellent. There is a convenient store at the bottom of building, an associated restaurant and also some local cafes and restaurants close by. Some rooms also rain showers, sep bath tubs and massage chairs.

Staff are friendly and there is always a duty manager around to assist if there are any queries. Room is pretty modern and its location to the Nishishinjuku metro is just a 5 to 10 mins walk away. Bed was comfortable. A cozy stay.

We stayed at this hotel for four nights. It is a new hotel. Although the room is small (which is standard) in Tokyo, it is very convenient. The room was clean. Although the bed was hard, we were surprised that we slept well. The staff and their services were excellent. The buffet breakfast was fabulous and had many different choices. We definitely will come back to this hotel again.

After booking a 7-night stay in a business hotel, we wondered if we would feel unwelcome at all. We didn’t. We were accommodated throughout our stay, with great service, a good buffet breakfast and a fantastic room. The room was well equipped, with air conditioning, an air purifier, a TV with a selection of movies, a good sized bathroom with both a rain shower and bath. The mattress was very firm, as others have mentioned, but we didn’t find it uncomfortable. Location also excellent, just a 5 minute walk from the metro and 15 minutes for some good food in Shinjuku. Hope to come back some day!

I love this place! The hotel is very new, opened in February. It is the most stylish of all the DR Hotels I have stayed in, a very attractive look, and there are many smart and thoughtful touches to be found in the hotel.Room 1215 is on the front of the hotel, facing east. It has twin double beds, a kind- of two- part couch, coffee table, large desk with a good task light, large TV, mini- fridge, In- room safe, coffee and tea service and trousers press. The desk also has two mains outlets and a USB charge point, very convenient.The bathroom is very modern and bright. The shower and tub are separated and in a glassed- in room next to the sink – and there’s a shower wand and a rain shower – plus, warning signs by the thermostatic control valve, so you don’t get surprised by water suddenly coming down from the rain shower overhead when you were expecting the wand to be the thing spouting water…The window is floor- to- ceiling and does not open, but the aircon works well and the controls are intuitive.The bedding is high- quality and very comfortable. Next to the bed are two USB charge points, two mains outlets and controls for the room lighting. Like some other DR hotels, the TV has real- time information on the status of the laundry machines and the breakfast queue – no need to go down the elevators only to find that you have to wait. Very smart.Breakfast is on 1F in a very nice space with lots of glass. Like other DR hotels, they have let the space to a commercial restaurant, who also do the hotel’s breakfast for them. It’s a clever idea – why have a space just for breakfast when it can also serve two other mealtimes as well? The food variety and quality are excellent, and it has a really fine cappuccino – espresso maker. GREAT! This “lease it” strategy also works well for the guest, as the spaces are more attractive and the food more varied from one site to the next.The hotel lobby is very attractive; the designer did a great job. There’s a 7-11 on B1F, you can enter it directly from the hotel. A convenient konbini, if you will.The Marunouchi Line’s Nishi Shinjuku Station is 350m away, the Toei Oedo Line’s Tochomae station is 730m away, and Shinjuku Station is a tad over 1km away from the front door to the west entrance gates. IMHO, it is not worth it to transfer to the Marunouchi Line from Shinjuku Station. There are some really good little restaurants in Nishi Shinjuku – but I fear that with so many buildings – indeed, a whole block just a bit west - coming under the wrecking ball, their existence is threatened. I hope not, I want to keep returning to this hotel.

Great new hotel located close to Shinjuku Station so convenient if using JR Pass and the Yamonte line. Lovely bathroom with great amenities but not much space to store large luggage. Convenient having a 7 eleven in the building so easy to buy drinks and snacks. Easy check in and check out and they held our bags after check out for the rest of the day. Only gripe is that the tv is at a strange angle so not easy to watch from the bed.

· Good size room for single person not so sure about 2 person.Nice corner room with bathtub.Love the flashlight near the bed.Good air-conditioning cold and strong.For Nishi Shinjuku it's a 5 min.walk .Cool high tech shower you get everything you need shaving kit tooth brush and paste and even a comb.Helpful stuff at reception.There was a survey on my table , fill It up very good thing.Love the magnet thing .7/11 down at b1 floor - life saver. · There is a green led in the room that's interfere to sleep.15 min. Of good walk from Shinjuku main zone.There was a lady's hair pin in my room for 3 days next to the toilet... Just waiting for someone to pick it up.Breakfast ends at 9:30..let us sleep some more.

We stayed here for 2 nights, and we have no complaints. The room is cleverly designed, space conscious but big enough to enjoy, big double beds, and amenities are very well maintained. Would highly recommend for people who like to explore Shinjuku but stay at a relaxing quiet place. The breakfast is very delicious too!

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The hôtel is brand new and modern so that’s pretty pleasant. Location is quite good, close to a subway tube station (5min walk) and 15min away from Shinjuku train station.The upsides were:- modern room and big nice bathroom- very nice breakfast; the buffet is varied and food is nice and tasty- good quality for the price especially for Tokyo- Seven Eleven on the basement floor is very convenient Downsides:- the staff’s ability to speak english is pretty low. For a hotel they should be able to speak a lot more english; this resulted in misunderstandings a few times; they could also make more efforts to be welcoming and helpful- the room is very small especially compared to the bathroom ; it would have been nice to have the space used a bit more for the room rather than the bathroom - the bed mattress is very very firm. Luckily you can ask for a mattress topper which helps a bit- this is more 3 than 4 stars hotel

We usually stay in the heart of the action but came across a great deal on this hotel so thought why not? Happy we did - room and bed were larger than usual for Japan and in particular Shinjuku. The hotel is almost brand new and located very close to Nishi Shinjuku metro station. Easy to arrive from Narita - just get to Tokyo station then hop on the Marunouchi subway line. The pulsing beat of Shinjuku & Kabukicho are not far away at all but there are heaps of restaurants & convenience stores clise to the hotel as well so both options are covered. In short - very impressed and if another fantastic deal were to come up then we wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Very nice hotel close to Metro. Very close to busy Shinjuku, but in a quiet area.Nice room, modern, great bathroom (heated toilet seats!) Everything you want in a hotel. Recommended. BTW - contrary to other reviews I have read - the room was not small. And the bed was very comfortable.

Staff unwilling to allow early check in (by 1.5 hours) unless willing to pay a large amount.Comfortable mattress and the room is just about ok in terms of size (which is slightly on the small side generally in Tokyo). Good location; 5 mins walk from nearest subway.

We stayed here for one night before we left Japan. Hotel surprised us, locates 3 minutes from Metro station. Modern and new rooms, in lower level is 7eleven so you can buy food, etc without long way threw streets. Price was reasoneable.

Just finished up three nights at this new hotel. The room is very small so if you have a lot of luggage you will be in trouble. The bed is very very firm. Therefore I didn’t sleep well at all. The bathroom is very nice. The worst part of this hotel are the small changes for everything. They wanted 400 yen to call a cab and another 800 if it booked ahead of time. They wanted 1000 yen to stay an extra 30 minutes in the room. They charge by the minute to use the telephone. All in all I cannot recommend this hotel nor would I stay in this hotel again.

Overall I liked this hotel, it was clean and modern and in a good location. However the rooms are small (although I’ve read these are bigger than average!). The beds are very hard, however the hotel did provide a mattress topper to soften it up and provided softer pillows. The only thing I didn’t like, was that we arrived 2 hours pre check in time and they wanted to charge us £15 to have the room, given the room was ready, I thought that was unreasonable.

Great location.. just 200m away from Nishi Shinjuku station and 1km away from Shinjuku station .... right in the centre but away from the crowd .. rooms were big as compare to the other hotels in japan and new .. they even provide us with hydration mask upon our check-in, lovely gesture..

I stayed with my son for 6 nights in my 1 st visit to Japan. The hotel is brand new . Location is great 100 m from nishi Shinjuku metro station and 10 min walk from Shinjuku. Room was good not very big but 4 stars + quality. Breakfast was amazing and we had one time lunch at the hotel restaurant and was very good. WiFi is perfect. Every floor have clothes washing machines i used one time and very helpful and easy to use it. There is a 7 eleven supermarket on the hotel zero ground in case you need to buy some water or snacks.If you looking for a quite and good quality hotel closed to Shinjuku I highly recommended this hotel.

We stayed at this hotel on March 9, 10 and 11, 2019. This hotel is located in the Shinjuku area, about a ten minute walk from the Hilton, Keio Plaza Hotel, and Shinjuku station. It's a new hotel and had only been open for a month when we stayed here. We had booked through Booking.com and check in was easy. Front desk reception spoke broken English, but it was good enough to help us locate a backpack we left behind on the bus from the airport (And we got it back intact!) There is a 7-11 downstairs for drinks and snacks and sandwiches. Room was clean, and they supplied shampoo, conditioner, etc. The room was smaller than a typical western hotel, but it was not tiny, and it was comfortable for a short stay. Location was a short walk to Shinjuku station.

The facilities are nice, and the location convenient.As it's a new place, the staff either need some more training, or the management concept is wrong.After chatting with the receptionist on check in, we were instructed to go check in at the e-kiosk. Why are there 3 people at the front desk, but we still have to pay in advance (?!) at a glorified ATM to get our room keys? It all just felt a little disorganized and impersonal.There was also insufficient explanation for the use of the card keys (for elevators, to get out of the adjacent 7/11, etc) or layout of the hotel and facilities.Parking is offered at a reasonable daily rate. But larger SUVs won't fit in their robot elevator contraption.

This very new hotel - it opened in February 2019 - is a welcome addition to Shinjuku. It is a superior class business hotel, Excellent beds. Good quality amenities - slippers, pyjamas, bathroom amenities. Good size and substantial bathroom with bath. Rooms are a good size for Japan, and especially for Tokyo. Quiet rooms. Professional front desk staff; enough English is spoken that a non Japanese speaker can easily check in and get advice. Free wifi. Tea and coffee in room. Helpfully, there is a 24-hour 7/11 in the basement of the hotel. In my view it is much more pleasant than, say, the Prince Hotel. It is not as grand as the Keio Plaza but you are just as well looked after and it is significantly cheaper. It is located just near the Hyatt and the Hilton. It is so new that taxi drivers do not know it. Give them or show them this address: Nishinjunku 6-12-39. that's how we got there. .

I ended up being stuck in Tokyo for a night due to a diverted flight... at 3:30 am... I called and right away they were ready to help me book a stay. I arrived at the hotel and for the low price, was surprised to find the amount of amenities available in my room. The front desk staff spoke English very well and were able to answer all my questions. They were able to upgrade my room as well without me even asking. I am so thankful for the amazing hospitality they have shown and will definitely keep this brand in mind when visiting Tokyo on my own terms ;)

We stayed there for 7 nights. I'm not sure if it's reopened or just opened but when we got there it seemed like they just had a opening ceremony and all employees were present. My partner was surprised to see everyone bowing to us (to which a respectful greeting in Japan).Everything in the room was nice and spacious compared to a common hotel in Japan. And I get to have a view of the buildings and Mt. Fuji! It is close to the subway and few minutes away from the Tokyo Metropolitan Government building. One thing that I'm surprised, they don't give complimentary water bottles. They said the water from the sink is drinkable. Which is A+ for most of us especially Europeans. But if you're scared, they have vending machines ready for you at the 11th floor or you can go to the basement and you'll find a 711.
